name: Dwarf Calicoflower
overview: Downingia pusilla is a species of flowering plant in the bellflower family. The flowers are typically inverted by the twisting of the ovary during blooming. Blooms from March to May.
habitat: Native to california it grows in valley and foothill grasslands and (mesic) Vernal pools
